de.esoco.lib.property

Interface MutableProperties

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HasProperties
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ColumnDefinition
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataSet, DoubleDataSet, IntDataSet, SimpleColumnDefinition, StringDataSet, StringProperties

    public interface MutableProperties
extends HasProperties
    An interface for objects that provide write access to named properties. Type-specific access methods allow to set and retrieve the properties. See the base class for further information.

    • Method Summary

      • setProperties

        void setProperties(HasProperties rOther,
                   boolean bReplace)
        Sets all properties from another properties object in this instance. The boolean parameter controls whether existing properties will be replaced or ignored.

        It depends on the actual implementations whether all properties from the other instance can be copied correctly into the target instance. It is therefore recommended to use this method only with properties objects of the same or a compatible type. Implementations should indicate incompatible data formats by throwing a runtime exception.

        Parameters:
        rOther - The instance to copy the properties from
        bReplace - TRUE to replace existing value, FALSE to only add non-existing values

      • setProperty

        <T> void setProperty(PropertyName<T> rName,
                     T rValue)
        Sets a particular property. Setting a value of NULL will remove the property from this instance.
        Parameters:
        rName - The name of the property
        rValue - The value of the property (NULL removes the property)

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> rName,
                 boolean bValue)
        Convenience method to set boolean properties.
        See Also:
        setProperty(PropertyName, boolean)

      • setProperty

                 int nValue)
        Convenience method to set integer properties.
        See Also:
